comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: One internet source states that the Cooyal Diggings/Linburn School was established in 1880 and closed in 1929.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
lifeasdaddy, you're exactly right! 
According to the publication 'Government Schools of NSW, 1848 to 1998' by the NSW Department of Education and Training, Linburn operated as a public school from March 1880 - October 1929. 
It was known as Cooyal Diggings until 1881.

comment.author: 44767713@N05
comment._content: Hi Fascinating looking over old drawings and plans isn't it? Thank you for sharing - I used your picture to illustrate a blog post on planning permission for solar roof panels. Seemed appropriate. Here's a link to the post and your photo in situ: solarpanelquoter.blogspot.com/2010/04/solar-roof-panels-w... Regards - Jonathan

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Thanks for letting us know, Jonathan. An 1882 plan is a creative way to talk about solar panels!
